intro: Epidorkis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered epidorkis, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing, evergreen shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in cymes. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Epidorkis micrantha is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
